sentences.en: A public challenge could provoke the Soviets to dig in.
sentences.cn: 公开挑战会促使苏联人一意孤行.

sentences.en: As part of their tactics, the opposition will try to provoke us.
sentences.cn: 反对派的策略之一就是要激怒我们.

sentences.en: Don't provoke the animal by teasing. It may bite you.
sentences.cn: 不要挑逗动物, 它会咬你的.

sentences.en: Don't throw one bone to two dogs; yoll'll only provoke a fight.
sentences.cn: 不要把这块骨头扔给那两只狗, 那样你会引起一场争斗.

sentences.en: Grandhi does not wish to provoke them any more than necessary.
sentences.cn: 甘地不到万不得已时是不想冒犯他们的.

sentences.en: His duty was to conciliate the people, not to provoke them.
sentences.cn: 他的职责是安抚那些人，而不是去激怒他们。

sentences.en: I said [ did ] nothing to provoke him.
If one firm goes under it could provoke a cascade of bankruptcies.
sentences.cn: 如果一家公司倒闭，便有可能引发一连串的破产。

sentences.en: If you provoke the dog, it will attack you.
sentences.cn: 如果你去招惹那只狗, 它就会咬你.

sentences.en: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.cn: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

sentences.en: She often tried to provoke Darcy into disliking her guest.
sentences.cn: 她常常挑拨达西使他厌恶她的客人.

sentences.en: Such tendentious statements are likely to provoke strong opposition.
sentences.cn: 这种有倾向性的说法可能招致强烈的反对.

sentences.en: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.cn: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.en: The novel has provoked fierce debate in the US.
sentences.cn: 那部小说在美国引发了激烈的争论。

sentences.en: Thinking angry thoughts can provoke strong physiological arousal.
sentences.cn: 想着生气的事情能激起强烈的生理反应。

sentences.en: This is likely to provoke a further row about the bank's role in the affair.
sentences.cn: 这有可能会加深关于银行在此事中的作用的分歧。

sentences.en: You'd better not provoke that fellow.

words.tran_cn: 刺激的；令人生气的，激怒人的

trans.tran_en: to cause a reaction or feeling, especially a sudden one

trans.tran_cn: 激起，挑起，煽动，招致，触怒，使愤怒
trans.tran_en: to cause a reaction or feeling, especially a sudden one
